messages.title: BRING BACK SIMON
messages.content: Local residents have been coming up to Simon Hughes in the past few weeks, urging him to run for MP again. Simon served as our MP for 32 years, until Labour won the seat in 2015. Simon says he’s very touched by the reaction he’s been getting from local people. The good news is Simon is running. We will have a chance to bring back Simon as our MP on 8th June.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Simon Hughes and the Liberal Democrats have always fought Brexit. The Liberal Democrats are united in their fight against Brexit, they are fighting for the rights of EU citizens and their children living in the UK, and they are demanding that the people have the final say on the final deal.

mentions.tacticalSituation: This general election is our chance to send a message on Brexit. A vote for the Liberal Democrats is a vote against hard Brexit.

issues.brexitEurope: The Liberal Democrats are fighting for the rights of EU citizens and their children living in the UK. Only the Liberal Democrats are demanding that the people have the final say on the final deal.
issues.health: Simon led the campaign to save Guy’s Hospital when it was under threat and fought for local health services.
issues.labourEmployment: Simon helped literally tens of thousands of residents with individual problems during his 32 years as our MP.
issues.transport: Simon made sure Bermondsey and Southwark stations were built on the Jubilee Line. Now he’s fighting for Old Kent Road and Bricklayer’s Arms on the Bakerloo Line.
